It might sound strange, but the right mattress and pillow can really change your life. This is because of the impact they have on the quality of your sleep. If your spine is kept straight and your pressure points are well-cushioned, you’ll sleep deeply throughout the night. The result: you’ll wake up without aches caused by poor circulation, feeling alert, positive and ready to take on every challenge you face in the new day.
Your mattress and pillow might have been great when you first bought them, but are they still supporting you today? The truth is that even a small decline in your bodily comfort can impact your ability to sleep deeply and get that refreshing sleep you need to live your best life.
Let’s focus your sleep position
Most people don’t get the full benefit of their sleep because they’re sleeping on a pillow and mattress that don’t suit the way they sleep. Think about how you fall asleep and wake up in the morning. This is mostly likely how you spend most of the night, and it determines what type of mattress and pillow will suit you best!
What type of sleeper are you?
Back sleeper
The best mattress for you provides medium to firm support, keeping your spine comfortably aligned while giving your lower back the support it needs.
Your pillow should give you soft support and have a low loft to gently cushion your head and keep your neck horizontal while you sleep.
Your perfect match: Sapphire Infini mattress and base set with the Sutton 2-piece feather pillow set

Side sleeper
The best mattress for you provides soft to medium support so that it’s plush enough to absorb the pressure on your hip and shoulder.
Your pillow should give you medium to firm support and have a medium to high loft, contouring to the shape of your head and keeping your neck stable throughout the night.
Your perfect match: Ultimate curve mattress and base set with the Rosita 2-piece hollow fibre pillow set

Front sleeper
The best mattress for you provides firm support to evenly distribute your body weight and relieve the pressure on your spine. We recommend Sealy Heaven Classic.
Your pillow should give you medium support and have a low loft to keep your airways open and your spine aligned.

Pro tip: Don’t get bogged down by the amount of options out there. Think of Goldilocks. The perfect match for you is simply the mattress and pillow that feels just right. Why not make a note of the options you like and try them out at a HomeChoice Showroom near you?
Pro tip: Don’t get bogged down by the amount of options out there. Think of Goldilocks. The perfect match for you is simply the mattress and pillow that feels just right. Why not make a note of the options you like and try them out at a HomeChoice Showroom near you?
But what if you and your partner share a bed? The best mattress for a couple should suit both of you. I recommend HomeChoice’s range of Restonic mattresses because of their Marvelous Middle™ technology, which provides great weight distribution and extra support in all the right places. I don’t recommend that two people try to share the same pillow.
